title: Greece’s conservative party takes commanding lead in election
description: The New Democracy party of PM Mitsotakis is scoring a resounding but indecisive victory against left-wing Syriza.

title: Russians celebrate reports that ‘fortress Bakhmut’ has fallen
description: Ukraine's president is denying claims that the eastern city is under Russian control after months of heavy battle.

title: Will worsening US relations with Beijing affect EU-China trade?
description: The United States has sought to increase pressure on Beijing.

title: Fentanyl: The new face of the US war on the poor
description: The US government is trying to blame the fentanyl crisis on drug trafficking but it is a disaster of its own making.

title: Why is Bakhmut important in the Russia-Ukraine war?
description: The symbolic importance of the small city in Ukraine's east now far outweighs any strategic value for either side.

title: Zelenskyy calls on G7 to ensure Russia is ‘last aggressor’
description: Zelenskyy’s visit to Japan highlighted significant divisions preventing the formation of a united front against Russia.

title: Tens of thousands rally in Moldova for EU membership
description: Demonstrators called on leaders to amend the constitution to specifically mention the country's European orientation.

title: Israel far-right minister visits Al-Aqsa compound
description: Visit of Itamar Ben-Gvir comes days after tens of thousands of Jewish nationalists marched through the Old City.

title: How important is Captagon in al-Assad’s return to the Arab fold?
description: The billions of dollars Syria's al-Assad is believed to be making from Captagon have given him a financial lifeline.

title: ‘Don’t have a problem with army chief,’ Imran Khan says
description: Former Pakistan PM tells Al Jazeera the government and military want to 'crush' his PTI party ahead of the polls.

title: Greece heads to polls in first election since end of bailout
description: Two main contenders are conservative Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis and Alexis Tsipras, who heads the Syriza party.

title: Iran says it is strong enough to defend regional waters
description: Tehran says the longest trip in its navy history is an indication that it is successfully circumventing US sanctions.

title: German police investigate suspected poisoning of Russian exiles
description: The inquiry is being handled by the state security unit, a specialised team that examines cases related to 'terrorism'.

title: Expats start voting in Turkey election run-off
description: Polls recommenced for Turkish expats on Saturday, presenting regional divide and growing urges for participation.

title: Tunisia: Tourism dreams and violence woes after Djerba attack
description: Kais Saied's government is working hard to minimise the recent attack on the Ghriba Synagogue, hoping to save tourism.

title: Greek elections so far: All you need to know in 400 words
description: A simple to the parliamentary election in the European Union country.

title: Haney retains titles with controversial win over Lomachenko
description: Lomachenko's camp slam the judges after Devin Haney retains lightweight boxing titles with unanimous decision.

title: Tea or chai? Celebrating International Tea Day
description: Across the globe, nearly all words for tea can be derived from the root-words cha or te.

title: Bahrain to restore full diplomatic relations with Lebanon
description: The Gulf nation has ended a year-and-a-half-long impasse as it looks to strengthen 'fraternal relations' with Lebanon.

title: At G7, Japanese PM pledges ‘unwavering solidarity’ with Ukraine
description: Prime Minister Kishida says Moscow's invasion of Ukraine struck at the 'very foundation of the international order'.

title: Iran hangs three on drug charges amid criticism
description: The latest executions were carried out after offenders were reportedly caught with large quantities of heroin.

title: First Saudi astronauts to blast off in private mission to ISS
description: Rayyanah Barnawi, the first female Arab astronaut, is also on the mission.

title: At least dozen killed in El Salvador football stadium crush
description: The police said initial reports point to a crush of fans who tried to enter the stadium to watch a match in the capital.

title: Russians ‘destroyed everything’ in Bakhmut: Ukraine’s Zelenskyy
description: His spokesman denies reports attributed to the Ukrainian president that the city was captured by the Russian forces.

title: Music and spirit go full throttle at Cape Verdean music festival
description: Musicians and other industry stakeholders converge at an annual Cape Verdean festival, to discuss evolution of the art.

title: G7 wants ‘constructive’ China ties, calls out rights record
description: G7 says it will not block China's development but calls out Beijing for its rights record and territorial claims.

title: Putin congratulates Russia troops, Wagner for ‘capturing Bakhmut’
description: Russian claims of capturing Bakhmut came hours after Ukraine said the battle for the eastern city was continuing.

title: Sudan’s army, Rapid Support Forces sign 7-day ceasefire
description: Truce will come into effect 48 hours after signing of agreement and is to be enforced by the US and Saudi Arabia.
